They have a little toy box for kids. Some games and a puzzle if you just want to relax inside. This was my second stay and would stay again!!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
As already indicated briefly: the view alone is well worth the price. The one sunrise was almost beyond belief--awesome! The "apartment" is spacious and could probably be advertised as such. The "laundry" was so nice and full-sized (though we didn't need it). The kitchen and eating equipment was wonderful and it even had a double-door frig. The sayings on the walls, etc. indicate that these owners are Bible believing folks but not overdone.
Also as already indicated briefly: the macadem driveway was a bit muddy--after the rain...due to cows, etc. And the well done steps down to the lovely apartment might be improved with a railing.

review_text: Such a beautiful place to stay! The place itself feels very private, it also has amazing views and the hosts cows love to say hello. I also love that it’s within 5-10 minutes of downtown Harrisonburg. It gives you the feeling of a private getaway but with options to go out without driving a further distance. Bryce was super nice and responsive, we also bought some breakfast sausage and steaks to make during our stay from their business and I highly recommend trying it! Would definitely consider staying again if I’m in the area.

name: Grant
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Bryce and the family are AMAZING hosts. This place is the best. We are already planning our trip back to the farm! The place itself is cozy and modern. The views of the hillsides are incredible. The host family is hospitable and warm. We got great food from the farm and recommendations for local restaurants and activities. The WiFi works well for remote workers. We stayed here for over 1 month, and we're so happy we did. The check-in and check-out process is seamless with our own door code: so no keys are required. There is plenty of space for parking. The location is close to all services, groceries, and a short trip to downtown. This Airbnb is a 10 out of 5. It is absolutely worth every penny of the price!

We only were able to stay 1 night but hope to stay here again sometime.
The bed was comfortable, bathroom and kitchen had everything we needed.
Bryce was a great host and we even had a chance to meet him at the Harrisonburg Farmer's Market (and meet his dad on the way in and out - "had" to buy some of their grass fed beef at the small shop on their farm.) Also highly recommend the bread from their neighbor (Mill Song Bakery!)
As everyone also notes, the view is so so pretty - and it's fun to be on a property with such a nice family including grandkids.

Stayed over a week
review_text: My partner and I wanted to explore the Shenandoah Valley and stayed at the Airbnb for a month while working remotely. The internet was very reliable and the place had everything we needed and was very clean. We put the kitchen to good use and had all the necessary items to make our meals. The hosts were very respectful and attentive, they even apologized for making noise while their family visited for the holidays (which we totally understood, but still very much appreciated them checking in)! In terms of the views, they speak for themselves. We loved waking up to the beautiful mountains and cows roaming the farm. If we are ever in the area again, this will be the only place I will be looking to stay again in!

name: Lea & Doug
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2021
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Pros
- Unmatched view! It was gorgeous! Try to be there during the day so you can watch the world go by. They even had binoculars near the main window!
- Quiet and comfortable.
- Everything looked new and clean.
- The apartment was extremely well-equipped. We gave the kitchen a good workout, and everything went well! Every small and large appliance we could have needed was there, with the exception of a dishwasher.
- Tastefully decorated, with beautiful and clever touches all over the place.
- Nice shower.
- Great communication with the hosts. We never saw them, but they were very accommodating to our wishes.
Information
The mattress was soft, like a cloud. If that's good for you, you'll love it! The bed also had a down comforter/duvet. :-)
The tall kitchen table seats three; they have plates and bowls for four; and the living room seats four.
Cons
None! This place is fantastic!

Bryce helped us with buying some delicious steaks before we left. We look forward to our next stay at the hilltop apartment!

review_text: It was such a wonderful stay we wish we could have stayed longer! We're hoping to make it back again. Please know that the cows are "out" but they are supposed to be. We were concerned when we saw one next to the driveway but they are kept in by the metal grates you drive over! It's very cool and you get to see them pretty up close first thing in the morning.

Communication responses were quick and Bryce answered all of our questions. We also purchased some meat from the farm and are looking forward to enjoying that very soon. I would highly recommend staying here and we look forward to booking with him the next time we are in town.

The apartment is comfortable, with a full kitchen and nice living area. The self check-in is nice when traveling a distance and not sure of arrival time. Appreciated the quiet and privacy of this location. Thanks for sharing your beautiful and comfortable space with us, Bryce! (thanks to the chickens too!)

We ended up buying some fresh ground beef from the farm before we left. On our visit we went snowboarding at Massanutten Resort, visited the Green Valley book fair, and ate at Magnolia's Tacos & Tequila Bar and Heritage Bakery. Bryce also has a wonderful list of suggested places to visit. We would stay here again.

The local coffee from Merge was wonderful - we stopped at the shop and bought some to bring home with us! The place was so clean and cozy and felt like a home away from home. Cory (Michael's puddle mix) was adorable and friendly and my daughter loved getting to meet him and hang out with him. Cannot wait to come back to the area and will definitely stay no where else except for Summit Escape.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We're regular visitors to Harrisonburg and wanted a break from hotel stays. We found the perfect alternative in Summit Escape. It is peaceful with spectacular views in 3 directions. It was spotless and comfortable and quiet with everything we needed--reliable wifi, ample options to recharge devices, a coffee maker and almost-full kitchen stocked with snacks and water if we wanted them. We met the host, Michael, and he could not have been more hospitable. Our weather was perfect so we drank in the view and listened to the mockingbirds during those times when we weren't visiting family. Grocery, drug store, and coffee shop all nearby. Just as an FYI, there are outside stairs to get to the unit but they are well-maintained and lit at night. Good signage and a dedicated parking spot make it clear when you arrive that you are at the right spot. We'll be back without a doubt. Thanks, Mike and Jen.

review_text: Had a wonderful two night stay for my birthday weekend! It’s tucked away up at the top of hill. The fresh air and mooing of cows below is so relax and fun. I can’t wait to come back! And the beanbag is definitely in my top three of favorite things at the escape!! 11/10 recommend!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: As a digital nomad, Michael's hilltop escape was exactly what we were looking for. The view is truly breathtaking and turns every day into something special even when you have to work from home. The unit itself is also well equipped with a comfortable bed, a functional small kitchen, clean bathroom with great water pressure, and even a white noise maker for sleeping! As for the outdoor space, the spacious deck is great for yoga, reading in the morning and working with a view. As for the area, Harrisonburg is such a gem! There are excellent breweries, cideries, and restaurants. There are trails as close as 30 minutes away. As for the hosts, I was so pleased with Michael's communication and his hospitality. Thank you so much! What a great stay!

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Booked this stay for a long weekend away for the first time away as a couple. Its perfectly located close to harrisonburg but far enough away to feel private. The studio was perfect for what we needed. It was very clean and the kitchen had everything we would need. There was a designated parking spot which was wonderful and the path to the stairs and the stairs had been salted after the snow to prevent slips. The view from the balcony was beautiful, i only wish it had been warm enough outside in the hammock chairs. The hosts even had a helpful guide of the area with suggestions on what to do. The only note we had was that because of the placement of the suite we could here at lot of the noise from the rest of the house so light sleepers be aware. Doors opening and closing, faint dog barks etc. On one of the nights of our stay the hosts had what we assume was a game night which was in the room next to the suite. There was a bit of shouting and carrying on. We mostly found it funny but we could see how it could be bothersome to a different kind of guest. They had wrapped up their night before 10pm so not bothersome to our sleep. Overall a fantastic trip and i would recommend this place to anyone

We just wanted some peace, quiet, and relaxation so it was absolutely perfect! This will be our new getaway spot!

The Summit Escape Apt has a great balcony with two swings and an amazing view anytime of the day! Very clean space with great amenities! Great host and great communication! Highly recommended for the quality of the space and the location! If you get the chance, visit Luray Caverns and Stable Craft Brewing Company!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Michael's place is a quaint upper level guest suite of their home with its own entrance. The suite is an open floor plan and you easily walk from living room, bedroom, and kitchen. We stayed here for access to Shenandoah National Park, and after a long day of hiking it was a nice touch to come back and unwind by watching Netflix on the SmartTV. The place was tidy and in order and had hand-sanitizer, masks, and gloves in the kitchen area for use. The kitchen is pretty minimal-- a hot stove with a single pan and a toaster oven for cooking, but plenty of cups , plates, bowls, and cutlery for use. The biggest draw is the deck. You get a gorgeous mountain view you can watch right from the bed, or sit out on the deck in the two swings and sip some coffee and take in the morning with a pal. Perfect stay for a hiker or couple for a short stay.

The Grey House was perfect for a quick getaway weekend! The historic property had so many tiny features that made our stay super comfortable. The sights, the fixtures, the horse, & the surrounding amber waves of grain had a real rustic feel. If you like to live some history while also having modern indoor plumbing, this is your destination.
Specifics: we loved the proximity to downtown Harrisonburg (lots of little shops & breweries), the many little touches of the unit (like a classic VCR & tapes & a vanity to beat all vanities), the property was walkable with barns & views of surrounding fields, & there was a very peaceful atmosphere that lets you really relax.

Upon entering, we were greeted by a warm and cozy family room that exudes charm and comfort. The half bath, with its moody ambiance, and the well-equipped kitchenette, gorgeous bedroom and master bath were just what we needed for a weekend escape. It's like stepping back in time while having all the modern comforts at your fingertips. There's a record player, and we found ourselves sinking into relaxation while enjoying some great tunes. The level of thought and care that Emily, the host, has put into every detail of this property is truly commendable. The Gray House is a haven of peace and quiet, and it offers the kind of comfort that makes you feel truly at home. We would highly recommend staying here, and cannot wait to return. Thank you, Emily, for creating such a remarkable and welcoming space.

review_text: If I could give 100 stars to the Urban Oasis and Howard, I would. It is by far the best airbnb I have ever stayed in. From the homemade cookies and sangria on arrival to toiletries and yoga mats, Howard has thought of every thing you could possibly need when you're away from home. I loved the local art decorating the walls. The space is so well used that it feels bigger than you would expect. I was sad when I saw rain in the forecast for the entirety of our trip, but we were still able to use the porch because it is fully covered and there are curtains on the side that help keep rain (and bugs) away. Highly highly recommend this place if you are visiting JMU or just want a relaxing place. We loved exploring but definitely looked forward to heading back to the Urban Oasis each day. I can't wait to book another stay here!

The kitchen was well stocked with appliances and he even included some grocery items that meant we could enjoy a breakfast in the room without needing to stop at a grocery store. We loved hanging out on the deck and listening to the bird song and watching the squirrels chase each other. When we are back in Harrisonburg we will definitely stay there again.

review_text: We were very impressed with Howard's approach to our use of his home and his willingness to explain or be available when called upon. The space was a bit smaller than we had realized, but well organized and well stocked in both kitchen and bathroom. Older visitors should be aware that the walk from the guest parking to the entryway is very uphill and calls for some degree of "being in shape" to navigate. That said, we (at 73 and 74 respectively) were able to navigate without much more that a need to breathe deeply. Also, the porch and swing are great!

I was sold on this place when I saw the picture of the porch swings! Beautiful setting in the treetops above a rural valley! It was very quiet and restful. Unfortunately, because I was so busy helping my parents at VMRC (right over the hill), mine was more of a sleep-and-go kind of visit. I did spend one tranquil evening lying on the porch swing, listening to the birds and the rustling of the leaves in the cool twilight. Heaven!
Only two things during my stay were less than perfect: (1) I did not fully pay attention to the very clear notice that the guest parking spot was so steeply below the house level (my fault, bring your sneakers); and (2) the clothes closet was not tall enough to hang my longer garments. I guess the outside setting was just so enticing that everything else paled in comparison!

The place is exactly as pictured and even better in person. Check-in was very easy as Howard gave clear instructions. The welcome was also so warm as Howard provided amazing cookies and sangria. The Airbnb was extremely clean, organized, and well thought out. And emphasis on clean because it was truly spotless and by far the cleanest Airbnb I ever stayed in! It was also very well stocked. We were able to cook meals easily and there were many coffee and tea options that we enjoyed. The bathroom had basics you would need like towels, shampoo and body wash and Howard also provided other useful items that we found helpful during our stay. Highly recommend!

The bed was comfy, including the sheets and pillows! And the bathroom was spotless! He had phone chargers already set up by the bed and desk so we never even used the ones we brought.

review_text: My gf and I had a great 3-night stay. It was comfy, cozy and has a mountain view that we enjoyed while relaxing on the patio. The best part about this space was how clean and orderly it was and we really appreciated all of the small details added that made it feel homey. The kitchen has all the essential cooking utensils anyone would need. We could tell there was a lot of thought put into setting up this space so that guests have all they need. There are iPhone and Android chargers, a speaker, plenty of pillows & blankets, shower products, emergency tampons, makeup wipes, and a makeup mirror which are such great touches for ladies. We didn’t need for anything at all. Howard was even nice enough to gift us a bottle of prosseco as an anniversary gift and some homemade cookies which were so good. Though a shared space, we felt like we had privacy being on the lower level. We didn’t hear much noise from above and actually only saw Howard one time. We would highly recommend this stay.

name: Kirby Eva
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Howard's unit is one of the most delightful Airbnb's my friend and I have ever stayed in. He is also the most thoughtful host I've ever had. If I ever need to stay overnight in Harrisonburg again, you better believe I will be staying here!
To start, Howard was very easy to communicate with! He was friendly and answered all of my questions promptly and without judgement. He provided ample information in advance AND inside of the unit itself.
The street the unit is on is lush, quaint, and quiet ~ save for delightful bird chatter and musical windchimes! It was easy to get to and about a 6 min. drive to downtown H'burg.
The studio has a gorgeous and inviting porch with comfy seating and string lights that you will not be able to resist.
Inside, the unit is even cuter than the pictures! It's a beautifully designed space, complete with local art work on the walls! The sleeping options were very comfortable ~ ample blankets and pillows were provided! The kitchenette had all that we needed, and even additional luxuries ~ there was a filtered water pitcher, a french press, and even a couple of treats waiting for us! The bathroom has a large mirror, with plenty of space for 2 people to get ready comfortably.
Every detail was thought of ~ there were apple & android phone chargers, a bose speaker, lotion and makeup remover in the bathroom, an egg crate foam cushion for the futon, and even a brush to wash bottles in addition to a sponge. These things may seem small, but they meant a LOT during a hectic weekend and made our stay incredibly comfortable.
I *highly* recommend staying at Howard's place!

review_text:
If you are looking for a place to stay near Harrisonburg, look no further. Among all the places my wife and I have stayed at this was one of the best.
The place was in pristine condition, all the dining utensils, appliances and accessory items are very clean and easily accessible. My wife and I travel quite a bit, and needless to say to have encountered places where dinner plates, utensils and appliances were not properly cleaned. Since then, we have been skeptical about using utensils at Airbnbs. However, Howards place threw us off totally. The dishes and utensils were squeaky clean, all the appliances were in working conditions and were also clean.
Howard had taken the time to make small pouches for pressed coffee so guests don't have to guess how much coffee to use. Made our coffee making experience so much easier. That takes time and a foresight.
My wife was especially impressed by the toiletries. It was very thoughtful to have feminine products, make removing wipes and a first aid kit. In so many Airbnbs that we have stayed in, we have never seen feminine products and making up removing wipes anywhere. There was travel side toothpaste, scrub, mouthwash etc. There was even a first aid kit.
Howards place is a home away from home. So much thought has gone into making this place as comfortable as possible. On our last day we had the chance to chat with him and get to know him a bit. He was very pleasant and friendly and make us feel very welcome in his home.

Quality (check): Cleanliness (check): Comfort (check): Amenities (check): Serenity (check): Hospitality (check): Attention to Detail (CHECK, CHECK). Nothing in all the other 5-star reviews is fabricated. They are all true. If you are fortunate enough to meet your host, Howard, you will witness the genuine concern he personally has for your comfort and enjoyment. I will, without a doubt, be back.

Howard's studio is very nice and clean, and the deck is very comfortable. We spent quite some time on the deck in Howard's comfortable "hanging" chairs. They were great. I broke my foot two days before we left. We planned to do some hiking, so instead we hung around. We relaxed and still had a great time. The relaxing was exactly what we needed. We did go into Harrisonburg where they had craft shops, bakeries, ice creams stores and regular restaurants. We liked Clementine's for dinner, and the bakery next to the information center for take away breakfast foods. The Arboretum is nice too, and nearby.
All in all it was a much better experience than I thought we would have. Howard also provides the renter with cookies and a stocked up refrigerator.

review_text: Howard's place is a small but stylish and comfortable studio in a quiet neighborhood within a reasonable distance to Shenandoah National Park (about 45 min. to 1 hour to some great trailheads) and near to other great hikes and sites in the area (only 20 minutes to Natural Chimneys and other nearby wilderness hikes). The studio itself has a well-appointed kitchen for all your cooking needs, including delightful snacks and drinks. The bed is quite comfy and the TV is setup for Roku streaming services. The porch swing is pretty dreamy with excellent bird watching opportunities right there in the front yard. Howard had all the bases covered and was warm and welcoming. Highly recommended!

We can't thank Howard enough for being such a great host and we hope to be back again in the near future!

review_text: I used this location as a base for hiking in the Shenandoah park, it is only a short drive to the historic center of Harrisonburg and a 20 minute drive to the park entrance at Swift Run. It is in a quiet location off a dead end street but easy to get to. It was tastefully decorated and well appointed. The kitchen had anything I could have needed including nice flatware, dishes and stemware and a selection of fine teas. Multiple coffee makers and a water filter were also provided. The bed was very comfortable and there was a couch, a big comfy chair and a small counter with two stools for a quick breakfast. The bathroom was large and well lit and came with some amenities such as a blow dryer, shampoo and body wash. The host thought of everything you could need for a short or long stay. The host followed up upon my arrival and made sure I was comfortable and had if I had any questions, they were very discrete and accommodating. I especially enjoyed the fresh baked cookies and scones, they were delicious.

If you are seeking a beautiful, and peaceful environment, this is the place for you!
Howard has clearly poured love, creativity, and hard work into every little detail of his space. We were lucky enough to double the amount of time that we could stay and it was worth every minute. We drove away fully relaxed, and recharged, ready to return whatever life might have in store for us.
We loved sitting on the tranquil porch swing while mediating in a private rainforest, this alone was worth the trip.
Howard was the quintessential host, excellent at communicating, and being available if needed, but plenty of privacy. The wifi was superior, the space was immaculately clean, and included a fully stocked kitchen loaded with thoughtful touches, tea, coffee, oatmeal, spices, and even things for baking. Homemade cookies and scones too!
We will be back here again to replenish! Highly recommend this space to anyone!

Our stay at the Martin Cottage was super! Eliot is a thoughtful host, in every sense. The house is tastefully decorated and extremely well-equipped, including lots of dishes, mixing bowls, pots and pans , cleaning supplies, travel items a guest might have forgotten, extra linens, etc. The “coffee bar” was ideal, complete with Peet’s coffee!
We also very much appreciated access to Netflix et al on TV. Loved the small deck looking over the back yard field below, especially when the traffic was light.
One more very important aspect of Eliot’s place is the lower level full of games, ping pong and even cornhole.
We heartily recommend the Martin Cottage!
Bonnie & Ernie Smith
Zionsville, IN

Group trip
review_text:
We loved our stay at The Martin Cottage! It was a peaceful area, just a few minute drive away from downtown Harrisonburg. The house is decorated beautifully and Eliot has thought of every amenity and nice touch to make his guests’ stay enjoyable. The coffee bar was a highlight! Eliot was easily to reach and very accommodating.
The only downside was that there wasn’t a door between the main level and the basement. So, in the morning, the people upstairs had to be super quiet to try to not wake up the people who were sleeping in the basement. (But if you all woke up at the same time, or didn’t have people sleep downstairs, it wouldn’t even be a problem.)
Bottom line: I highly recommend it. We had a great stay!

review_text:
It was an awesome treat to stay at the Martin Cottage --thank you to Eliot and his wife for such a welcoming and "home away from home" stay!
The surroundings are beautiful --a delightful country setting, just a few miles from James Madison University. I ran on the main road that leads to The Cottage, and even though it's a busy road, I felt safe. Views on my run included rolling hills, lots of cows, bubbling brooks, historic churches, and gorgeous sunrises.
Eliot and his wife go out of their way to provide amenities -from coffee to goodies at check in, and everything was very clean. There is lots of room to enjoy at The Cottage, so it would make a great place for a family get away. ~ I was there for a work related trip and needed excellent wifi --The Cottage did not disappoint :--)
I highly recommend not only The Cottage, but Eliot and his wife as hosts. <3

review_text: We loved staying at Carrie's home again. It is a very nice neighborhood and close to everything. We visited Woods Edge Farm just down the road and there is a Food Lion not far away. The flowers in the neighborhood were gorgeous. I thought they were fake at first because they were so pretty! Carrie's home is very comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable and the shower was great. Carrie's place is excellent for those with mobility problems. No steps to get in or around inside and no steps for the shower. The washer and dryer were very helpful, so we didn't have to pack much for our trip. The temperature was perfectly comfortable. We never turned on the TV because there was so much for us to see while we were there. I did use the internet once and had no issues with connectivity. Everything was very clean. We stayed here again because we enjoyed it so much the 1st time and we'll stay there again when in the area.

review_text: Carrie's basement apartment was amazing. Absolutely everything we could have needed for cooking, plates/cups/utensils, cleaning supplies, laundry essentials, as well as some pantry staples we're included (rice, spices, sauces, etc). Even a blender, teas, coffee. The bed was incredibly comfortable, as were the pillows. My husband and I stayed here with a friend, who said the air mattress and bedding was comfortable as well. She went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The apartment is underneath their household, so there is some noise, but we actually loved hearing their dog occasionally as it reminded us of our dogs at home. On our last day, we had car trouble and needed to have it fixed before we could drive 7 hours home. Carrie let us check out a couple hours late so we could get that sorted out. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone lucky enough to find availability. Thank you again Carrie!

review_text: Carrie truly is among the best of the best when it comes to hosts. Prior to booking, she was quick and informative when responding to questions. We were looking for a place to stay while visiting Massanutten resort. This was only about 30 minutes. Shortly before our visit, Carrie reached out to make sure we were aware of the upcoming snow storm that the area was expecting. She also let me know that if conditions were too bad and we needed to stay an extra night, that they had the availability. While visiting, she made sure everything was as expected, that the driveway was shoveled for us, and provided an awesome recommendation for a place to go sledding that was just a few blocks away. The apartment was beautifully decorated and stocked with all the normal essentials and then some. This place exceeded my expectations and I would book the apartment againin a heartbeat if I need accommodations again in the area.

,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Count yourself lucky if you are able to score a reservation at this charming and lovely AirBNB in the heart of a peaceful retirement community in Harrisonburg, VA. This place is truly a hidden gem and a rare find. The apartment looks exactly as advertised and your host Carrie has seen to it that every convenience has been provided for your comfort .One can easily see that the apartment was just remodeled and everything worked very efficiently. Also, the entire place was immaculate. The kitchen was fully stocked with all the appliances and accessories you could want and the bathroom was just as pictured with a laundry hidden away behind closet doors. One of the best features for me was to treat myself to as many outdoor café breakfasts, lunches and dinners as I could make on that lovely patio that sits to the side of the entrance. The scenery from there at night is just beautiful. Another really nice perk was being able to drive up my own private driveway right to the front door almost. That was a really big help getting things back and forth from the car to the apartment. Your host Carrie, always responds within minutes of receiving your communication and will go out of her way to provide whatever convenience you might need to make your stay more comfortable. She really exemplifies the meaning of "Super Host". This AirBNB rates 5 stars across the board for exceptional everything. I highly recommend you try and get on the waiting list for this beautiful little home away from home. You will not be disappointed.

review_text:
This was my first Airbnb experience and Carrie made it so comfortable and pleasurable with her warm and welcoming hospitality. We couldn’t have asked for a better hostess or environment. Carrie and her family live upstairs, but you will rarely hear any sounds; maybe an occasional bark, or chair moving. Our favorite was listening in as her daughter practiced her piano! Delightful! The apartment was perfect for a couple and well equipped for our time away from home. Cozy and so nicely decorated. I especially loved the shower! Felt like a luxury hotel, complete with soft fluffy towels! She really supplies everything you need. Very responsive and helpful in recommending places to eat and things to do during your stay. Friendly and fun to connect with.
Carrie has beautiful gardens and shared her raspberries and lettuce with us. She encourages her guests to use the little patio and even provided tiny string lites in mason jars to enhance our evenings spent outside! I could go on and on. We are already looking forward to our next stay! Don’t hesitate to reserve this apartment. You will be so glad you did!

review_text:
We had a very nice weekend stay in this perfect little downtown spot!
Quiet and safe neighborhood. It’s a short and easy walk downtown to tons of shopping, bars, restaurants, farmers market, etc.
The space is completely updated, very comfortable, well appointed and spotlessly clean.
The host was very communicative and accommodating. He took the time to provide two very helpful welcome books full of great tips, local recommendations, etc. Definitely take a few minutes to read through them - They are very well done and spot on.
There’s parking for two vehicles, but, just a heads-up: it is a narrow driveway. Our Honda pickup fit, but it was tight. Consider a smaller car if you have the option.
Overall, a great find. Would definitely stay again.
Thanks!

review_text: Our one night stay at Josiah’s was more than I could have asked for. We aren’t far from home but didn’t want to drive back while my daughter was attending a two day camp at JMU. Hotels in the area were pricy and more than we wanted to spend. Josiah’s space was perfect for my daughter and I! Wi-Fi worked perfect for me to get a little work done in the evening, was able to access my work VPN with no issues! Loved the ice in the freezer and book of recommendations. We got bagels from the recommended spot and they were AMAZING. The house is secluded private and quiet but still so close to town. The bed did make a little noise when getting in/rolling over etc. wasn’t problematic to us but was more worried about noise upstairs for Josiah :-) Thanks for everything!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We loved our stay at this Airbnb. Josiah was super friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The suite was really nice and we agreed it was much better than a hotel! Noted from another review, it can be a little tricky to find the first time, especially during nighttime - the driveway is a couple hundred feet farther up the road than Apple Maps said and when the driveway splits, stay to the right! There is marked parking and stairs going down to the suite. There is a little bit of noise overlap between the suite below and the main house above due to an air vent running between the two - not a big deal but good to note (there is a portable fan provided if you need a little extra white noise when you sleep).
Josiah provided great food recommendations and was super responsive during our stay. We stayed here to be close to Shenandoah National Park. The Airbnb is a little over an hour from the top entrance and 20 minutes from the closest entrance. We highly recommend staying with Josiah!

name: Brandon
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I met and communicated with Victor during my overnight stay. He met me promptly at the clearly marked Airbnb parking entrance and showed me the space. Everything was very clean and comfortable. I would recommend the space for anyone who needs a small space for a short stay.
While the place was excellent and inexpensive, do be aware the space is, as advertised, small. There is also no microwave, or at least not one that I could find. The air conditioner kicking on and off is a bit loud. You can hear footsteps and floor creaks, but there was very little movement in the house and the movement was outside a decent range of sleeping hours. These things did not bother me and I would stay here again, but I could see them being an issue for anyone with sound sensitivities.
There are other nice little touches, such a surge with multiple USB charging points. Water, hand sanitizer, wipes, and a lot of the essentials.
Victor was very friendly and accommodating. I'll be looking to stay again.
